intro: Blepharis calaminthifolia, commonly known as the silverleaf grass, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its narrow, silver-gray leaves and delicate, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. Its flowers are often visited by bees and other pollinators, contributing to its ecological significance. The species is sometimes cultivated for ornamental purposes due to its attractive foliage and unique floral structure.
